predictions.text: BLS will publish the delayed U.S. Employment Situation report for January 2026 (full release PDF and tables) by 2026-02-11 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the Bureau of Labor Statistics posts the January 2026 Employment Situation release (news release PDF and accompanying tables) on bls.gov on or before 2026-02-11 UTC; otherwise NO.
evidence: News reports state the January jobs report was delayed due to the U.S. government shutdown and rescheduled for Feb. 11.
BLS has historically released Employment Situation reports on announced reschedule dates absent further operational disruptions.
monitoring_signals: BLS announcement updates on release timing
Status of government shutdown / BLS operational capacity
BLS release calendar changes and pre-release lockup notifications
predictions.rationale: This tightens the prior deadline to the publicly reported rescheduled date, while acknowledging residual risk of further shutdown-related slippage.

predictions.text: The CBOE Volatility Index (VIX) will close at or above 30.0 on at least one U.S. trading day by 2026-03-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if VIX official close (Cboe / major market data feeds) is ≥ 30.0 for any session with trade date on or before 2026-03-31; otherwise NO.
evidence: Macro uncertainty elevated due to shutdown-delayed data and recession-risk chatter (weak ADP).
Tech/AI-adjacent valuation fragility suggests higher tail-risk for equity volatility spikes.
monitoring_signals: VIX level and term structure (contango/backwardation)
Major macro releases once shutdown effects clear (CPI, payrolls, ISM)
Equity index drawdowns and intraday realized volatility
predictions.rationale: VIX ≥30 is plausible in a risk-off episode but remains a tail outcome over ~2 months.

predictions.text: The Nasdaq-100 index (NDX) will close at least 10.0% below its highest close of calendar year 2026 (to date) on at least one day by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if, by 2026-04-30, NDX has a closing level that is ≤ 0.900 × (highest NDX close observed during 2026 up to that date). Data from Nasdaq official history or a major index data provider.
evidence: Recent broad tech selloff and high expectations in AI-related names increase correction risk.
Macro uncertainty (delayed labor data; private credit stress narratives) can amplify growth-stock downside.
monitoring_signals: NDX peak-to-trough drawdown tracking
Earnings revisions for mega-cap tech and semis
Real yields and financial-conditions indices
predictions.rationale: A 10% correction is common historically, but timing is uncertain; elevated dispersion in tech raises odds versus a calm regime.

predictions.text: Alphabet will publicly indicate (guidance or stated expectation) that its 2026 capital expenditures will be at least $65 billion (USD) during an earnings release/call or SEC filing by 2026-04-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if Alphabet (Google) states 2026 capex (or 2026 capex guidance/expectation) ≥ $65B in an earnings press release, prepared remarks, earnings call transcript, investor presentation, or 10-Q/8-K on or before 2026-04-30 UTC; otherwise NO.
evidence: Reporting indicates Alphabet plans to sharply increase AI infrastructure spending, resetting capex expectations upward.
monitoring_signals: Alphabet earnings date and capex commentary
Data-center/AI infrastructure procurement news (servers, GPUs, networking)
Supplier capex and capacity indications tied to Google demand
predictions.rationale: Public narratives point to a step-up in AI capex; $65B is a concrete threshold that should be confirmable in official communications.

predictions.text: The U.S. Department of Commerce (BIS) will add at least 5 new China-based entities to the Entity List with a stated rationale substantially related to AI, advanced computing, or semiconductor development/production, by 2026-05-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if BIS publishes (Federal Register notice and/or BIS press release) one or more Entity List updates by 2026-05-31 that newly lists ≥5 entities headquartered in China, where the stated basis references AI, advanced computing, semiconductor design/manufacturing, or related supercomputing enablement; otherwise NO.
evidence: U.S.-China strategic tensions remain elevated, with AI compute a persistent focus of U.S. controls policy.
monitoring_signals: BIS Federal Register notices and press releases
Leaks/briefings on new U.S. export-control packages
Allied coordination signals (EU/Japan/Netherlands statements)
predictions.rationale: Entity List additions are a frequently used tool; the question is cadence and scale over ~4 months.

predictions.text: The FOMC will lower the Federal Funds target range by at least 25 basis points (relative to the range in effect on 2026-02-05) by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if the Federal Reserve announces at any scheduled or unscheduled meeting on or before 2026-06-30 that the target range for the federal funds rate is reduced by ≥25 bps versus the target range effective on 2026-02-05; otherwise NO.
evidence: Weak ADP print and recession-risk chatter increase the probability of an easing pivot within coming meetings.
Policy uncertainty from shutdown-driven data disruptions can raise the chance of a risk-management cut if conditions deteriorate.
monitoring_signals: Inflation prints (CPI/PCE) and labor-market releases after shutdown
Fed speakers signaling concern about growth/financial stability
Fed funds futures implied probability of cuts
predictions.rationale: A cut by end-June is plausible but not the base case without clearer disinflation or labor-market weakening.

predictions.text: NOAA will report the Mauna Loa atmospheric CO2 monthly average at or above 430.0 ppm for at least one month by 2026-06-30 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if NOAA’s Global Monitoring Laboratory (Mauna Loa) monthly mean CO2 (ppm) is published as ≥ 430.0 for any month with data released on or before 2026-06-30; otherwise NO.
evidence: Long-run upward CO2 trend plus typical seasonal spring peak increases likelihood of crossing a new round-number threshold.
monitoring_signals: NOAA Mauna Loa preliminary and final monthly CO2 postings
Weekly/daily CO2 readings during spring peak season
predictions.rationale: Given trend and seasonality, 430 ppm is more likely than not by late June, but exact monthly averaging can miss narrowly.

predictions.text: At least one of the following publicly traded U.S. business development companies (BDCs)—ARCC, OBDC, FSK, MAIN—will announce a cut (decrease) to its regular dividend per share (not a special dividend) in a dividend declaration made by 2026-08-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any listed BDC publicly declares a regular dividend per share that is lower than its immediately preceding regular dividend per share, with the declaration date on or before 2026-08-31; otherwise NO.
evidence: Coverage highlights private-credit stress and refinancing risk, which can pressure BDC earnings and distribution coverage.
monitoring_signals: Quarterly earnings: net investment income, non-accrual rates, NAV changes
Credit-spread widening and default-rate indicators
Company press releases on dividend declarations
predictions.rationale: Large BDCs tend to smooth dividends; a cut is a meaningful stress signal but not the modal outcome.

predictions.text: At least one of Ørsted, Equinor, BP, Avangrid, or RWE will disclose an impairment charge of at least $1.0 billion (USD) related primarily to U.S. offshore wind assets/projects in a quarterly or annual financial report filed/published by 2026-08-31 (UTC).
predictions.verification_criteria: Resolves YES if any named company publishes or files financial statements by 2026-08-31 that explicitly disclose an impairment (or write-down) ≥ $1.0B attributable primarily to U.S. offshore wind projects/assets (can be reported in USD or converted at reporting-period FX); otherwise NO.
evidence: Policy and permitting delays for wind/solar projects raise the risk of project economics deterioration and write-downs.
U.S. offshore wind has a recent history of large impairments amid cost inflation and contract resets.
monitoring_signals: Company earnings releases and annual/interim reports
State PPA renegotiations/cancellations and permitting timelines
Project financing updates and turbine-supply cost changes
predictions.rationale: Large impairments are plausible if delays persist, but timing and accounting triggers are uncertain within two reporting cycles.
